thread.title: Who were the Romans? Mythbusting life in the ancient Empire
thread.title_full: Who were the Romans? Mythbusting life in the ancient Empire

title: Who were the Romans? Mythbusting life in the ancient Empire
text:
Who were the Romans? Mythbusting life in the ancient Empire Share Download (23.40 MB) MP3 available 23.40 MB 
Shushma is a Greco-Roman historian and a lecturer in Classics and Ancient History at The University of Queensland. 
In this conversation, she confronts some of the outlandish stories swirling around the ancient Romans. 
Did the Romans really throw Christians to the lions in the Colosseum? 
Did they actually gorge themselves during feasts; and then bring it up in a 'vomitorium', so they could go back for another course? 
Did Caligula really appoint his horse as a consul? 
Often the truth behind these stories is far stranger than the myth. 
Further information and listening
